result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard D. Westcott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two or if not perform 10 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample.
285 days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I&S for rules violations. With huber for work, school, and treatment if defendant is eligible under jail criteria.

superMiscConds.notes: FTE, schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization. 

No possession of drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  AODA. 

Any employment/money-making activity must be pre-approved by agent. 

DNA sample.  

Defendant MUST serve a minimum of 30 months before programming is available to defendant.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:01 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
State requests COMPAS assessment in PSI not be considered. No objection. COURT notes it will NOT consider COMPAS assessment. 
Atty Sawyer notes corrections to PSI. 
COURT notes revocation packet, independent PSI, and letters submitted by deft's friends/family, and questions parties if they are received all documents. 
Both parties have received all documents. 
Atty Sawyer provides additional letter to the Court. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 10 years imprisonment - 5 years IC and 5 years ES -  CONDITIONS of ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no possession of drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions; any employment/money-making activity must be pre-approved by agent; unpaid CC; DNA sample and surcharge. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 578 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft is eligible for CIP and SAP - deft must serve minimum of 30 months before programming is available to deft. 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidential. 
COURT ORDERS PSI and defense PSI to be sealed. 
COURT remands deft to the custody of the MCSD for transport to the WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 9:54 am

PSI Report-SEALED
stj
to Judge Jacobson from Atty. Sawyer - stj
Sent to Judge
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-06-2015 09:00 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:21 am 
INCLUDES 14CF5 AND 14CF54. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Rick Cveykus. 
Atty Cveykus withdraws filed motion. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF5: Ct. 2 (Possess with Intent THC)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>>D&RI.
               : Ct. 5 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 6 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 7 (Possession of THC)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
               : Ct. 9 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF54: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                  : Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 14CF5: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Cveykus makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 4 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; 75 days MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if def is eligible under jail criteria imposed and STAYED for rule violations; DNA sample; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 285 days jail credit if revoked. 
Adj: 9:39 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 23, 2014 at 09:50 am.

Clerk Marisa.
